item.description:
Learning to ID trees in winter is an entirely different experience than doing so other times of the year! When you don't have leaves to help you, let the form, height, habit, bark, context and other characteristics be your guides. Enjoy a few hours out in the fresh air at Robinson Woods learning about the wonderful tree species in this "gem" of a location just a few miles from downtown Portland.

This event will run about 2 to 2.5h depending on questions.

Our guide, Shawn Clarke, is a utility and first class landscape arborist and has been working with our local trees for twenty years. He has a passion for trees and plants and grew up just a couple of miles from Robinson Woods.

Dress in layers for the weather and feel free to bring notebook/camera. Meet in the parking lot on Shore Road. If there's heavy snow on the ground, feel free to bring snowshoes.

Rain/Snow date is March 14th all other details the same. In the event of a date change we will post a note on this event page by 8am.

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Skillshare: Winter Tree Identification Walk with Arborist Shawn Clarke
